intro: Trembleya phlogiformis var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy trembleya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist forest understories. The varietal name 'villosa' refers to the hairy texture of its stems, a distinguishing feature of this variant.
